official-title.#text:
To prohibit the use of global health activities to collect foreign intelligence, and for other
			 purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Global Health Worker Protection Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Global Health Worker Protection Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Prohibition on use of global health activities for intelligence gathering

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and any other department or agency may not use health or
			 humanitarian workers or activities, including immunization and vaccination
			 campaigns, health education and surveillance, or direct health services,
			 in countries outside of the United States for the purpose of collecting
			 foreign intelligence.

text.#text:
Nothing in this Act shall be construed to restrict the provision of medical services to individuals
			 involved in authorized intelligence activities on behalf of the United
			 States.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4747 IH: Global Health Worker Protection Act of 2014

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
